review:
鼓励性好评，暂不推荐。

202211下，t a o宝，支付宝红包，杉果，本平台，本平台充值折扣掉卡，indie gala，fanatical，humble，daily indie game，loot boy，它处自定义包入的本体约3元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198068102627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1698067646}
review:
Kinda on the fence on this one, i would give a thumbs-mid if i could.

Originally built for smartphones with touch displays, it made its way to the PC.
While controlling it with a mouse makes it somewhat easier, it doesn't have the same vibe to it.

With that said, you get exactly what you expect. It's a goofy arcade game for a short period of time, but nothing more. The creator (Ashley Gwinnell, formerly Force of Habit) is giving some interesting insights to indie game developing: https://youtube.com/channel/UCa-dpzd9Zcc8bPAm18CpQDA

+Funny theme with adequate visuals and sound design
+Light-hearted ambience

-Nothing much to get engaged with
-Unlocks are grindy

review:

Notes: Fast paced goofy arcade game with a fair amount of RNG and shenanigans to go with it. While the game notoriously has one of the worst and/or most difficult achievements in probably the existence of the world "Iron Terry", ignoring that, the base game and going for all of the 3 stars was pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082764480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1691914362}
review:
Toast Time is a game where you try to fend of enemies from an alarm clock by shooting breads. You move the opposite direction of where you shoot which makes up for a very awkward and hard to control gameplay.
I tried to give it a fair shot and played it for a while but i can't see myself finishing the game for multiple reasons.
The game is literally a mobile game. Not even a proper port, ui and aspect ratio is not suited for pc. This game might be a fun time killer on mobile but i can't see any reason why someone would want to play this instead of tons of other great games on steam. Related to that also is the controls feeling off and imprecise. Your character is very bouncy which results in an uncontrollable rage game especially on later levels where you have to stay on the ground to protect the clock.
I probably got it in a bundle and wanted to check it out but i would advise you against buying it or playing it since it is just a very basic time-killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081145379', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1609282748}
review:
[h1] Juego para móvil controlado con el ratón [/h1]

Port de un juego móvil, que no ha sido adaptado correctamente.
El control es con el mouse, lo cual hace que sea bastante incómodo.
A pesar de ello podría ser un juego entretenido, casual, para jugar un rato en el metro o bus.
El tema es gracioso, los gráficos simples (2 colores) hacen que a veces sea difícil enterarse de qué está pasando en la pantalla y la música graciosa también.

Aún así, el control y el aspect ratio hacen que no merezca la pena para PC, ni gratis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1507322693}
review:
Tags: Casual - Twitch - Shooter
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: A host of technical issues. Limited gameplay. Lacks features. Game design issues.

Oustanding Issues:
+No Xbox360 pad support
+No real resolution support
+Play area in shape of phone in middle of screen with lazily extended art
+Protag bounces back when fighting making control chaotic
+HUD information bugs out with text overlaid on top of text
+HUD information include FPS and half a dozen statistics about in-engine things such as variable swaps and whatnot which is probably some devmode being left enabled
+Audiovisually flat with white on color X presentation, and gameboy grade sprites and audio
+Gets repetitive fairly fast, you will often lose combos and hit the clock by accident by bouncing around due to the physics which hurts your feeling of flow and mastery

Conclusion: Very litte in the way of redeeming quality. The british humor was nowhere to be found. Removed for declutter

author: {'steamid': '76561198414365640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1506194915}
review:
手机屏幕上的射击游戏，子弹飞行速度不快所以要预判，后座力强大主角自己也会满屏乱飞。虽然有打地板自己能往上飞的设定，但因为连击数很影响过关判定，这个设定就很鸡肋了，操作华丽反而断了连击数分数就低了。

主角好像是块面包，打的是便便，也是恶搞，就是像素太低了。

挺好玩的小游戏。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1707597096}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - Seriously Flawed ★★☆☆☆[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1]
My sense for the quality of Steam titles was quite low initially, so I didn't realize that I probably wasn't going to be a fan of Toast Time (TT) when it showed up in a bundle. A simple, yet fun game about blasting enemies with toast sounds kind of odd. It could have been pretty enjoyable too, but there's a few key issues that really hinders the experience. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
There's two game modes available in TT. The first are referred to as Missions, and after clearing enough of those stages, you'll unlock Survival Mode. Most of the missions are solely focused on keeping the enemies from making contact with the clock, as you wait out the timer until enough time has passed. While shooting at the enemies with your projectile, crates will occasionally spawn in, giving you one of the weapons that you've currently unlocked. The more crates you obtain, the more options that will be available. Unfortunately, what weapon you're given is completely random, instead of being pre-set to better match the layout or situation. Picking up a crate might give you the perfect weapon, or something that's nigh worthless. Occasionally, a mission will have a unique effect in place, such as limiting how many shots you can fire.

What I find odd about the game is Survival Mode, also known as Iron Man Mode. As you might expect, it's set up as a gauntlet, where you have to clear every stage without failure. Any mistakes forces the player to start over from scratch again. None of that is unusual, but you unlock this mode long before you finish every stage. I'd think the sensible thing to do would be to open this option after clearing each stage, as an additional challenge. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3158066937
[h1]Controls[/h1]
This was one of the areas in the game that I found unsatisfactory. Shooting at enemies causes immense recoil to your character, and when you're firing on multiple foes, you'll wind up flying all over the screen. Just keeping up with the enemies spawning into the stage can be difficult, but with this affecting your place on the screen and sometimes putting barriers between the enemies and where you want to shoot, it's a significant burden. It's the equivalent of a 3D shooter, but one where you don't have direct control over your position on the map, because each gunshot propels you around instead. That'd be a nightmare, and it's no better here.


[h1]Story[/h1]
Because this is an arcade experience, there isn't any plot behind being a living toaster fighting sentient... water? They look like drops of rain and icicles, but I'm not really positive. Then again, everyone knows how water is a toaster's greatest enemy, so I'm guessing that'd be the logic here. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3158066229
[h1]Visuals[/h1]
I'll give the game some credit, for being able to make cute sprites out of a title that makes use of so few colors at any time. Unfortunately, the developers weren't more considerate for the side effect this would lead to. When the screen gets busy, it's very difficult to distinguish one thing from another, because all the crucial elements are the same color: your projectiles, the clock, your own character sprite, and of course the enemies. Even if they just changed the projectiles and enemies to different colors, I think it'd help quite a bit. Ironically enough, the background has a gradient effect, so it'll subtly change from one color to the next, while all the crucial objects are all white.


[h1]Sound Design[/h1]
From what I noticed, the songs are played in a random order, or at least aren't specific to the stage or set of missions you're currently on. They don't seem to end in time for the stage wrapping up, which isn't too surprising with how short each one is. Any given one might last for 35 or less seconds, so the tunes don't get much time to get anywhere. I have to think that continuously playing the songs that'd continue despite a stage ending or you failing would work better with these limitations. The short refrain that plays out after beating a stage is enjoyable enough.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3158066679
[h1]Pros[/h1]
🌟 Honestly, I love the lighthearted and silly premise this game has. Arcade games don't have to be gritty and realistic to be engaging, they can be cute and silly.
🌟 Power-ups drop into the stage, helping to even the odds against the merciless, smiling enemies. 


[h1]Cons[/h1]
❌ Once you see the orientation of the game on your PC, you'll figure out that this was originally a mobile game that was ported over. TT isn't too outrageously priced, but I think it has enough issues that it should be on the cheaper side. 
❌ There's an achievement for playing this title for just under six hours, yet it's rarely earned. The game also has cards, which would lead to many people grinding for the unlocks, and hasn't bumped this up to even 2%. 
❌ The mechanics don't work in solidarity with each other, making for a frustrating experience.


[h1]Tips[/h1]
🔍 If a power-up generates in an out of the way place, it's probably not worth getting, since you may not be able to get back into place in time.
🔍 Firing at enemies with intention seems to be the best approach. Spamming attacks without regard for anything won't always work.


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
There's a few areas in games that will almost always cause problems, and TT includes two of them. First of all, the controls make the game much more difficult than it needs to be, as firing on the enemies flings you around the screen. It feels punishing when that's the only option you have to fight back, aside from crashing into the ground near them. Although a different problem, the lack of color and distinction between your projectiles and the enemies leads to a similar outcome. When you have a hard time telling what's happening, it comes across as unfair, which is how the lack of control over your own character feels. Despite the cute, silly premise, playing this game isn't nearly as fun as it might look, so I wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014445799', 'num_games_owned': 990, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1471302933}
review:
A enjoyable minigame, where mechanics are based on inertia and tower defense. You are a little toaster that must defend a clock from some... lemons? garlic? (i don't know) until the clock discharges its power.

Something tells me this game is focused to use with a touch pad, but anyway, i did'nt find it very annoying to use with the mose.

The "8-bit" like music is catchy and changes very often in the game.

For me, is not worth $5 dolars, but for a $1.25 is worthy to try something diferent. At least 20 minutes of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020522032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1650617754}
review:
A greatly underrated little game with amazingly energetic music.

Basically a shooter, you use the mouse to aim at silly little smiling monsters who are trying to break your alarm clock.  Your guy Terry isn't hurt by monsters himself, but wherever he fires, he's flung in the opposite direction.  At first this isn't much of an issue, but it isn't too far in where you're having to choose your shots carefully to stop your heroic slice of toast from getting hurled behind barriers and unable to hit his grinning foes.  Additionally crates fall from the sky; shooting one gives Terry a random powerup from all those unlocked.  Some of these require quite a bit of skill to use, but others fill the screen in a gratifying spray of breakfast ordinance.

Additionally, each level rates you on the now-traditional three star scale.  Getting that third star in later levels can become a heroic undertaking.  Sometimes it feels as if the third star, on certain levels, requires getting a specific powerup, which is a bit tiring.  Still though, it is a fun little game that's worth a few dollars at least, and has been nearly invisible in terms of promotion.  It's worth a look!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036220129', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1483906946}
review:
Toast Time is a retro shooter with a twist. It looks quite hectic as player invulnerable player character is bouncing around the screen. 

Bouncing around actually is big part of the challenge. Obiously shooting is means to kill enemies, but it's also is only way to move. So while shooting, it's also important to pay attention where player character is actually going. In later levels it's usually some place that's hard to get out from and somewhere that's doesn't have access to clock that needs to be defended. 

Levels have different twists, which keeps gameplay varied. Also there's unlockable guns (or bread, it's Toast Time after all). 

But all in all, Toast Time has best of the retro game qualities, frustrating, but still very addictive. Give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033605026', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1443365789}
review:
This game goes for retro/classic graphics and fails. It's retro alright. Bad retro. Game Boy 1 graphics were better.

Also, it was clearly designed for mobile+touch platform, which does not help it's case.

On the plus side it's got interesting control mechanics and a quick pace. 

But I've played (much) better free-to-play games on Steam.

Not worth it. 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996457595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1433820729}
review:
You like toast, right? You wake up in the morning, pop your bread in the toaster. Maybe put a spread of some kind on it.

Well too bad! Minions are here to ruin your breakfast.
Are you going to let that happen?

Fight back with your 8-bit toaster oven!
Outfit him with unlocked hats and clothing! (I prefer the Monocle and Top Hat)
Shoot toast like projectiles at various baddies!
Break crates to get awesome power ups!
Upgrade your bread to exploding bagels, rapid fire english muffins, or the fire baguettes like missles!
Belly-Flop!
Prevent the enemy from reaching the alarm clock!
SAVE YOUR BREAKFAST!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043588164', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1431960522}
review: El problema de este juego son los controles. Es muy obvio que está diseñado para dispositivos móviles y me hizo sufrir para poder pasarmelo. El hecho de que tu personaje rebote con cada disparo dificulta mucho el apuntar y por si fuera poco el ratón, al ser blanco, se confunde con todos los objetos de la pantalla, los cuales son blancos también. Opino que este juego hubiese sido mucho más divertido si pudieras moverte con WASD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176529887', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1428880708}
review:
I went into this game hoping it wouldn't be a try-hard old school game, and to my surprise, it really isn't.

Toast Time executes the old-style arcade style very well, without making it cheesy. The idea is innovative, and very fun to play. This is a game you can play while watching TV or a movie, and not worry about losing, as it doesn't take much of a mind to play. 

Just pick it up, and play.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1430610184}
review: While i had seen enough after less than an hour, i would certainly recommend giving this a try if you can get it cheap. The style is awesome and things get hectic and hilarious once you start bouncing around. It's also the only game i know of where you kill things with baguettes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038398969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1434860410}
review: Some games go for that nastalgic retro look and pull it off. This game does not. The gameplay is as dull as the graphics look. If this game is in the free to play section, demand a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1432051269}
review:
トースターのテディくんが色んなパンを射出することで
襲い来るよくわからないものから目覚まし時計を守る
元スマホゲーなのを隠そうともしない縦長画面の防衛ゲー

操作はクリックしたとこに向けてパンを撃つ以外に何もなく
移動もその反動で行うんだけどこれがアストロロボSASAも
びっくりの吹っ飛びかたでまるでコントロール出来ない

地上で真上に向けて撃っても地面の反発力で跳ねちゃうし
真横に向けて撃つと飛ばしたパンとまったく同じ速さで
反対方向にカッ飛んでいくのだからどうしようもない

しかも連射が効かなくて一発外すと終わりな場面多いし
そのわりに弾としてみると初速が足りなくて当てづらいし
PC向けにカーソルをでかく描画する気ないからすぐ見失うし
挙句の果てに弾数制限つきのステージもあったりして
1ステージ40秒とかの短期決戦なのにやたら難しくて疲れる


ただ偶然見つけたデバグ用っぽいスライダーを動かしたら
ゲームスピードが下がってほどよい難易度になりましたとさ
めでたしめでたし
[spoiler]キーボードのAとDを続けて素早く押す[/spoiler]と使えるよ

author: {'steamid': '76561198002757537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1430000962}
review: I appreciate what the developer tried to do with this game, which is develop a minimalistic, retro style arcade game. However, the randomized items together with controls that extremely impede precise movement, make it hard to recommend the game. The aesthetic is well put-together, the theme is cute, but the game ends up just being frustrating. Instead of having to think how to solve the levels you end up hoping to get the proper item to do the job.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999298643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1427368483}
review:
I honestly did not get this game. It's obvious its primary platform is mobile phones, since you play in an upright aspect ratio. I found it extremely cumbersome trying to navigate with a mouse, and wonder if it's any easier pointing at a screen on a cell phone.
Otherwise a nifty little game with innovative gameplay, great simplistic graphics and catchy music. I just don't have time to wrestle with the controls like I did, thats all. Thought it more frustrating than enjoyable, but I can see why other people would like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000099591', 'num_games_owned': 1538, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1410710529}
review: Básicamente es un juego portado desde dispositivos móviles a la PC. No digo con esto que esté mal, pero creo que se disfrutaría más en una tablet o un smartphone. Lo he probado por menos de una hora, y la verdad es que he terminado pasando de este. Me gustan los juegos de este tipo, pero son más para uso ocasional, como cuando vas en el metro esperando a llegar a casa. Para mí, los juegos de PC deben estar un poco menos enfocados a la diversión sin mayor recompensa que el hecho de gastar tiempo frente a la pantalla. Pero es cuestión de gustos. Lo recomiendo, pero sólo si tienen pantalla touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970365871', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1409148592}
review:
What is Toast Time?

A bloody good little game! That's what. 
[url]http://youtu.be/PWR3DBJLEH8[/url]

Get hyped up on coffee and go save breakfast from evil little buggers, that want to do nothing more than to deprive you of your syrupy dripping noms first thing in the morning.

In it, you're Terry. A rapid firing toast launching toaster, that needs to save the best meal of the day. 
The entire game is controlled via the mouse, once you fire a slice you're hurled back by the force of the recoil. Which you can then use to navigate the little map to ensure you can dispose of the breakfast crashing buggers!

Like doughnuts? SURE, fire a bajillion of them at whatever the hell those evil little things are. French toast, bagels, baguettes, and more! Just lob them all over over the place, and protect that little alarm clock.

The graphics might be the pinnacle of old school, but it complements the game perfectly, and the music is outstanding. 
Toast time, is simply fun. Pure fun, condensed into silliness, and I enjoy it.

It's easy to overlook the direct port, with just added mouse controls; as the game is still in portrait mode. It simply doesn't matter due to have addictive and fun the little game can be.

I would heartily recommend this to anyone that just wants some toast filled fun. Even more so if you want to get it on a mobile device.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4500, 'num_reviews': 1010, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1410379541}
review:
I could write the shortest review ever for Toast Time but that wouldn’t do it justice. Not entirely, at least. Because it looks simple doesn’t mean that it is simple. Toast Time is a port of the original iOS/Google Play game and it’s actually very fun (and frustrating) to play, even if you can clearly see its mobile roots.

The goal in this game is simple: protect the clock from ringing by fending off tons of enemies with your character (who is a slice of toast). You can do this by shooting bread at them and it’s done with the press of a mouse button. Simple. But, there’s something else you have to take into account. By shooting bread you will also thrust yourself into the opposite direction. Call it recoil, call it crazy physics, call it anything you want, but one thing’s for sure: it makes the game damn hard, especially halfway through the game when the levels are designed in a way that you can’t navigate through them properly without carefully planning your shots. It makes for some stressful situations as more and more enemies approach the clock and by missing just one shot you can risk losing the game entirely. Fortunately for us the levels are short and can be finished within several seconds to several minutes, max. Restarting them takes only a few seconds and after that you’re on your way again. ‘Just one more time’ is what you’ll be saying time and time again, because of the way the game (re)loads levels so quickly. Well played, Toast Time. Well played.
The clock functions as some sort of base, by the way, and if only one enemy bumps into it you will fail the level. It’s absolutely necessary to protect it. A difficult task, but made easier with your (unlockable) weapons, which brings me to the following point:
Collecting boxes during your playthrough allows you to unlock a new random weapon (of the collection that you already own) that might make your objective easier. For every x amount of boxes you collect you’ll unlock a new weapon. Some of them are useful, others are, erm, less useful, depending on the situation of course. There are also cosmetic items to unlock like a monocle or a tophat. Funny stuff, but not really needed for a single-player game except to give the character more personality.

Graphically Toast Time uses a retro look. Its graphics reminded me a bit of Meat Boy, or any other game designed by Edward McMillen. The older generation I mean. It’s flashy and there are a lot of things happening at the same time and it’s easy to lose sight of where your character is located because your character, the projectiles, the enemies and even the environmental objects are all white and therefore blend in with each other. It’s very easy to make mistakes because of this and I think it would’ve been a good idea if it differentiated certain things.
Since the game was originally made with mobile phones in mind the game is also shown as a full screen rectangle (i.e. like the screen of a mobile phone) with borders on the sides that show off a bit of the environment. It works fine and it isn’t annoying or distracting.
Sound wise the game is basic. The music is cheery and up tempo and the sound effects like shooting projectiles or smashing into the ground are satisfying. I don’t think the sound effects could’ve been any better to be honest, even if they are so basic. They just fit the style and nature of the game.

I think that finishing Toast Time will take at least several hours, I’m not sure yet, as I haven’t been able to complete all the levels yet. Some of them are just so frustratingly hard, and a few of them also require a bit of luck. But like I said, it’s fun for short sessions. Don’t play this non-stop. You’ll most likely get bored before you ever even finish the game. Short sessions are the best and I personally think they do the game more justice. 
Toast Time is an excellent shoot ‘em up/tower defense/action game with a couple of flaws, but these can be easily overlooked. I, for one, had a very good time with it and I would absolutely recommend it to people who enjoy any or all of the previously mentioned genres.

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]
